feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:24AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MOOSE GLACIER DAMMED LAKE IS RELEASING AND COULD CAUSE HIGH WATER IN KENAI LAKE AND COOPER LANDING AREA... WHAT: There is reason to believe the Moose Glacier Dammed Lake (GDL) has begun releasing. WHERE: Biggest impacts at Snow River leading into Kenai Lake and downstream into the Kenai River and the Cooper Landing area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 2:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CONFIDENCE INCREASING FOR HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... A front over the eastern Gulf of Alaska will stall on the outer coast this evening. A second front with atmospheric river characteristics will merge with the first and shift west before stalling once again, this time over the northeast Gulf Coast. Heaviest rain totals through Friday night will be located over
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Yakutat; Glacier Bay

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:15AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Elevated to near critical fire weather conditions expected today between 1 PM and 7 PM MDT. Minimum relative humidity values 12 to 16 percent and west to southwest wind gusts 20 to 25 mph are possible. Any fires that develop may spread rapidly. Caution is advised if outdoor burning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County
